definitions.definition: An articulation marking directing that a note or passage of notes are to be played in an abruptly disconnected manner, with each note sounding for a very short duration, and a short break lasting until the sounding of the next note; as opposed to legato . Staccato is indicated by a dot directly above or below the notehead.
Any sound resembling a musical staccato.
examples: According to the syllable-timed hypothesis, Spanish syllables as staccato.

main_definition: ( music ) An articulation marking directing that a note or passage of notes are to be played in an abruptly disconnected manner, with each note sounding for a very short duration, and a short break lasting until the sounding of the next note; as opposed to legato . Staccato is indicated by a dot directly above or below the notehead.
secondary_definitions: ( music ) A passage having this mark.
( figurative ) Any sound resembling a musical staccato.
